Description: Create a Lustre cluster with 4 Object Storage Servers using EBS volumes. **WARNING** This template creates multiple Amazon EC2 instances and related resources. You will be billed for the AWS resources used if you create a stack from this template.

Dashboard.Description: Monitoring interface for the Lustre servers.

AccessFrom.ConstraintDescription: must be a valid CIDR range of the form x.x.x.x/x.
AccessFrom.Description: Lockdown access to Lustre services (default is accessiable for 0.0.0.0/0)

HTTPFrom.ConstraintDescription: must be a valid CIDR range of the form x.x.x.x/x.
HTTPFrom.Description: Lockdown access to Lustre Ganglia on MGS (default is accessiable for 0.0.0.0/0)

KeyName.Description: Name of and existing EC2 KeyPair to enable SSH access to the instance

NATInstanceType.ConstraintDescription: must be a valid EC2 instance type.

OstRaid.Description: Configure how storage is used by the lustre target. Stripe mode creates a single Lustre target on a RAID0 volume containing all available storage volumes. JBOD mode creates one Lustre target per available volume.

SSHFrom.ConstraintDescription: must be a valid CIDR range of the form x.x.x.x/x.
SSHFrom.Description: Lockdown SSH access to the NAT host (default can be accessed from anywhere)

VpcId.ConstraintDescription: can contain only alphanumeric characters, spaces, dashes and underscores.
VpcId.Description: Id of an exisiting VPC that contains a public subnet i.e. vpc-d54ebebf

VpcPrivateCIDR.ConstraintDescription: must be a valid CIDR range of the form x.x.x.x/x.
VpcPrivateCIDR.Description: CIDR for new private subnet i.e. 10.0.2.0/24

VpcPublicSubnetId.ConstraintDescription: can contain only alphanumeric characters, spaces, dashes and underscores.
VpcPublicSubnetId.Description: Id of an exisiting public VPC subnet i.e. subnet-ae4ebec4

WebServerPort.Description: The TCP port for the Web Server

Properties.GroupDescription: Enable internal access to the NAT device
